result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Devone Nicholas Nash.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing remains scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Devone Nicholas Nash.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests bail/bond and plea/sentencing hearings.  Court set dates as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail.  (Devone N. Nash - #2022006951, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Devone Nicholas Nash.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash, in court, appear by video with attorney Brett Lee Copeland, appear by video.  Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD J. Dummann.     State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on vacation. Defense moves to dismiss; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for level 5 SUPERVISION.  All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Devone Nicholas Nash not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set cash bail.  Case adjourned for a preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on June 4, 2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until June 10, 2022 at 8:30 AM for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 40.  Notice is given to Public Defenders Office and District Attorney.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,000.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant having failed to appear of his release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Services Discharge Report 5.16.2022
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION-t - Missed Scheduled Contact) Report; filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MMC 6/16/2000; MAO 12/01/1999; 1432 Locust Street
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devone Nicholas Nash appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Devone Nicholas Nash not in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/21/22 @ 1p
